original_text:
**INSTITUTION
CRITICAL CARE MEDICINE
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN PROGRESS NOTE
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
**ROOM
ATTENDING PHYSICIAN :
**NAME[YYY M ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Nov 19 2007]
EVALUATION DATE :
**DATE[Dec 28 07]
**INSTITUTION VISIT :
Mr. **NAME[AAA] has done well overnight and was able to stay off the BiPAP for the first time in the last 24 hours .
On examination this morning , he is afebrile .
Vital signs are stable .
His mean arterial pressures have been between 70 and 80 .
He is breathing comfortably between 18 and 24 times a minute .
Oxygen saturations are 98% on six liter nasal cannula .
The abdomen is soft and nontender .
His air entry is good bilaterally .
He appears to be severely cachetic with his significant protein and calorie malnutrition .
Laboratory examination shows a decrease in his bicarbonate to 37 .
BUN and creatinine are stable at 18 and .7 .
Glycemic control has been adequate .
His prealbumin is up slightly from last week 's level of less than 7 to 11 this week .
Plan today is for continued ICU monitoring in terms of his pulmonary insufficiency .
Overall , his general frail medical condition would prompt me to leave him in the Intensive Care Unit for at least another 24 hours for reevaluation .
His blood pressure control has been adequate on the current regime .
He did have some bleeding from his wounds , so I have discontinued his heparin drip and left him on baby aspirin and started him on subcutaneous heparin as well .
He has stress ulcer and DVT prophylaxis and he is receiving tube feed at his goal rate with refeeding of the bile that is drained via the
PTC catheter .
___________________________________
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
Dictator :
**NAME[WWW M. XXX] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Dec 28 2007] 20:16:52
T :
**DATE[Dec 28 2007] 20:32:21
R :

**DATE[Jan 19 2008] 02:55:24 PM
